With current evidence showing that severe COVID-19 mostly affects people of advanced age associated with noncommunicable diseases [ 52], the odds of survival appear to favour Africans. Furthermore, the expression pattern of human angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), a receptor for SARS-CoV-2 to gain entry into cells, appears to be low in Africans compared to Asians, further favouring the possibility of positive outcomes [ 53, 54].
